alert.note: Alert for Henry Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 10 at 3:01PM MDT until June 13 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 10 PM MDT MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 494 BELOW 7500 FEET... The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a Red Flag Warning below 7500 feet for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon Sunday to 10 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 494 Henry Mountains. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph Sunday afternoon and evening and again Monday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 5 percent, with marginal overnight recovery of only around 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Critical fire weather conditions are expected. Any new fire starts or existing fires may spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
